snippet: In his first interview, Dr. Ian Crozier, who was treated for Ebola at Emory University Hospital, speaks of what he saw treating the disease and his near-death experience after he was infected.
abstract: Dr Ian Crozier, in interview, discusses his near-death experience after contracting Ebola virus while treating patients in Sierra Leone; Crozier, who until recently remained anonymous, spent 40 days battling disease after being airlifted to Emory University Hospital in Atlanta; relates some of hardships and dangers that have confronted those who have volunteered to fight epidemic, which has claimed lives of more than 330 health care workers.
lead_paragraph: In his first interview, Dr. Ian Crozier, who was treated for Ebola at Emory University Hospital, speaks of what he saw treating the disease and his near-death experience after he was infected.

headline.main: An Ebola Doctor’s Return From the Edge of Death
